no.hig.hers.ludoclient

Class GameTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.hig.hers.ludoclient.GameTest

  • public class GameTest
extends java.lang.Object
    The code is from GameBoardFX. The tests checks if it is possible to knock out another players pawn, enter goal, and make a tower. Class that keeps track of the Ludogame. It holds all the game logic and stores information about every pawn. It also draws the game board and the pawns onto the board.
    Author:
    Bj√∏rn, Hauken

    • Method Detail

      • someTest

        public void someTest()
        Constructor of the ludoBoardFX class. Makes all the possible coordinates for the pawns, adds pawns to each player and draws them, and makes the gameboard.

      • getpawnInGoalLocation

        public int getpawnInGoalLocation(int col)
        Method that goes through the color of the paramter and checks if a pawn is on the goal location. If it is, the pawn nr will be returned and added to a goal array, to keep track of all the pawns in goal.
        Parameters:
        col - Holds the color of the pawns that is to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns the pawn nr if the methods finds a pawn on the goal location, or returns 5 to deny it.

      • addPawns

        public void addPawns(java.util.ArrayList<GameTest.Pawned> pawns,
                     int color)
        Add 4 pawns for the player with the spesific color and adds them to the arrayList of that color.
        Parameters:
        pawns - Holds the spesific arrayList of the spesific player color. The pawns are added to this.
        color - Holds what color of the pawns that is being made.

      • getGreenCoordinates

        public java.awt.Point getGreenCoordinates(int i)
        Returns the point at the element @param i in the Vector of the green color.
        Parameters:
        i - Holds what point is to be returned
        Returns:
        Return the point that is requested.

      • testTower

        public void testTower()
        Checks if it is possible to make a tower. Adds two pawns of the same colour and places one on top of the other. If they become a tower the test is ok.

      • testKnockout

        public void testKnockout()
        Tests if it is possible to knock out another players pawn. Adds two pawns of different colours. Places one of them on top of the other. If the bottom pawn gets placed in home, the test is ok.

      • testGoal

        public void testGoal()
        Checks if the pawn can enter goal. Place a pawn on goal, if it is placed in goal, the test is ok.
